meanings.sent1: Her philosophic approach to life helped her make sense of the world.
meanings.sent2: The professor's philosophic lectures on ethics were always thought-provoking.
meanings.sent3: He took a philosophic stance on whether pineapple belongs on pizza.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a philosophic array of colors.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins held a mysterious and philosophic aura.

meanings.definition: Having or showing a calm and rational attitude towards difficult situations.
meanings.sent1: Despite the chaos, she remained philosophic and focused on finding a solution.
meanings.sent2: His philosophic response to the crisis inspired others to stay composed.
meanings.sent3: She maintained a philosophic demeanor even when her coffee spilled on her laptop.
meanings.sent4: The captain's philosophic leadership steered the ship through the storm.
meanings.sent5: The old wise owl had a philosophic gaze that calmed those around it.
